exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: A full-body exercise that can be done anywhere. Jump while spreading legs and raising arms overhead, then return to starting position.

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: A cardio-intensive exercise performed in place. Run in place while lifting knees as high as possible.

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.description: Stand with arms extended to the sides. Make small circular motions, gradually increasing the size.

exercises.name: Butt Kicks
exercises.description: Run in place while kicking heels up towards your glutes. This dynamic movement warms up the hamstrings and increases heart rate.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.description: Start in plank position. Alternate driving knees towards chest in a running motion. Great for cardio and core activation.

exercises.name: Windmill
exercises.description: Stand with feet wide, arms extended. Bend at waist and rotate torso, touching opposite hand to foot. Mobilizes spine and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Hip Circles
exercises.description: Stand on one leg or hands and knees. Make large circular motions with your hip joint to increase mobility and warm up hip flexors.

exercises.name: Half Middle Split (HMS Lunges)
exercises.description: Start in a wide stance. Shift weight from side to side in a lunge position to stretch inner thighs and hips.

exercises.name: Walking Pike
exercises.description: Start in plank, walk hands back towards feet keeping legs straight, then walk hands forward. Stretches hamstrings and warms up shoulders.

exercises.name: Core Engagements - Floor
exercises.description: Lie on back, lift legs and shoulders off ground while engaging core. Hold briefly and release. Activates deep core muscles.

exercises.name: Squats
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower hips back and down as if sitting in a chair, then return to standing.

exercises.name: Relevé
exercises.description: Rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting heels as high as possible. Strengthens calves and improves ankle stability.

exercises.name: Half Wood Chopper
exercises.description: Stand with feet wide. Rotate torso while bringing arms diagonally across body in a chopping motion. Warms up obliques and spine.

exercises.name: Hand Kicks
exercises.description: Stand and kick one leg up while reaching opposite hand toward the foot. Improves hamstring flexibility and coordination.

exercises.name: Hamstring Stretch (Lying Down)
exercises.description: Lie on back, raise one leg and pull it toward chest using hands or a strap. Gently stretch the hamstring.

exercises.name: Lunge Step (with High Knee)
exercises.description: Step forward into a lunge, then drive the back knee up explosively. Combines strength and dynamic movement.

exercises.name: Plank Skiing
exercises.description: In plank position, jump both feet side to side together like a skier. Engages core and builds cardiovascular endurance.

exercises.name: Deep Plié
exercises.description: Stand with feet wide and toes turned out. Lower down into a deep squat, keeping chest lifted. Targets inner thighs and glutes.

exercises.name: Half Split Push Outs
exercises.description: In a half split position, push hips back and forth to dynamically stretch hamstrings and hip flexors.

exercises.name: Assisted 1-Legged Pike Stretch
exercises.description: Sit with one leg extended. Fold forward over the extended leg, reaching toward the foot to stretch hamstrings.

exercises.name: Leg Swings (Standing)
exercises.description: Hold onto a wall or bar. Swing one leg forward and back in a controlled manner to warm up hip flexors and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Burpee
exercises.description: From standing, drop into a squat, kick feet back to plank, do a push-up, jump feet back to squat, then jump up. Full-body conditioning.

exercises.name: Rocking Boat
exercises.description: Sit in a V-sit position with legs and torso lifted. Rock back and forth in a controlled manner to engage core and improve balance.

exercises.name: Seated Hip Rotations
exercises.description: Sit on the floor with knees bent. Rotate knees side to side to mobilize hips and lower back.

exercises.name: Runner's Stretch (Active)
exercises.description: In a low lunge position, pulse forward and back to actively stretch hip flexors and quads of the back leg.

exercises.name: Core Engagements (Tuck)
exercises.description: From a hollow body position, pull knees to chest in a tight tuck, then extend back out. Advanced core control exercise.

exercises.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
exercises.description: A gentle stretch to warm up the spine. On hands and knees, alternate between arching back (cow) and rounding spine (cat).

exercises.name: Wrist Rotations
exercises.description: Rotate wrists in both directions to prepare them for weight-bearing exercises.

exercises.name: Elbow Lifts
exercises.description: Lie face down with hands behind head. Lift elbows off the ground while squeezing shoulder blades together. Strengthens upper back and rear deltoids.

exercises.name: Forehead to W
exercises.description: Lie face down with forehead on ground. Lift arms from overhead position to a W shape while engaging upper back muscles. Great for scapular control.

exercises.name: Back Extensions
exercises.description: Lie face down, lift chest and shoulders off the ground while keeping hips down. Strengthens lower back and spinal erectors.

exercises.name: Hip Bridges
exercises.description: Lie on back with knees bent. Lift hips up, creating a straight line from shoulders to knees. Activates glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Hip Bridges (with 1 leg)
exercises.description: Perform hip bridge with one leg extended. More challenging variation that increases glute activation on the working side.

exercises.name: Open & Close Wrists
exercises.description: Make a fist then spread fingers wide repeatedly. Warms up wrist flexors and extensors for handstand work.

exercises.name: Prayer Pose
exercises.description: Press palms together in front of chest. Push hands down while keeping palms together to stretch wrist flexors.

exercises.name: Prayer Pose (Reverse)
exercises.description: Press backs of hands together with fingers pointing down. Stretch wrist extensors by pushing hands up.

exercises.name: Straight to W
exercises.description: Lie face down with arms straight overhead. Lift arms and pull them down to W position. Builds shoulder and upper back strength.

exercises.name: Prone Y's
exercises.description: Lie face down with arms in Y position overhead. Lift arms off ground while engaging upper back. Strengthens scapular stabilizers.

exercises.name: Superman
exercises.description: Lie face down, simultaneously lift arms and legs off ground. Hold briefly then lower. Strengthens entire posterior chain.

exercises.name: Wrist Mobilization
exercises.description: Make circles with wrists in both directions. Can be done with hands in prayer position or arms extended. Prepares wrists for load.

exercises.name: Y-T-W
exercises.description: Lie face down. Lift arms in Y position, then T position, then W position in sequence. Advanced upper back and shoulder control exercise.

exercises.name: Leg Lifts (Together & Separate)
exercises.description: Lie face down. Lift both legs together, then lift them separately alternating. Strengthens glutes and lower back with variation.

exercises.name: Up & Down Waving
exercises.description: On hands and knees, rock weight forward and back over wrists in a waving motion. Builds wrist strength and mobility.

exercises.name: Side Waving
exercises.description: On hands and knees, rock weight side to side over wrists. Prepares wrists for lateral forces in handstands.

exercises.name: Wrist Walks
exercises.description: On hands and knees, walk hands in small circles. Mobilizes wrists in all directions and builds strength.

exercises.name: Finger Stretch
exercises.description: Press fingers back gently to stretch finger flexors and forearms. Hold each stretch. Important for preventing finger strain.

exercises.name: Wrist Mobilization (All Directions)
exercises.description: Systematically move wrists through all planes of motion - flexion, extension, radial/ulnar deviation, and circles. Complete wrist prep.

exercises.name: Wall Slides
exercises.description: An exercise to improve shoulder mobility and posture. Stand against wall, slide arms up and down while keeping contact with wall.

exercises.name: Shoulder Dislocates
exercises.description: Hold a band or stick with wide grip. Keeping arms straight, rotate it from front to back over your head.

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.description: Hold resistance band at chest level. Pull hands apart, squeezing shoulder blades together.

exercises.name: Shoulder Rotations
exercises.description: Stand with arms at sides. Make controlled circular motions with shoulders forward and backward. Warms up rotator cuff and increases mobility.

exercises.name: Shoulder Stretch (Standing)
exercises.description: Stand and pull one arm across body at chest height using opposite hand. Hold to stretch shoulder and upper back.

exercises.name: Handstand Line Builder
exercises.description: Against wall, practice achieving and holding perfect handstand alignment - straight line from wrists to shoulders to hips. Advanced body awareness drill.

exercises.name: Puppy Pose
exercises.description: Start on hands and knees. Walk hands forward while lowering chest toward ground, keeping hips over knees. Deep shoulder and spine stretch.

exercises.name: Forward Shoulder Stretch
exercises.description: Clasp hands behind back and lift arms up while bending forward. Opens chest and anterior shoulders.

exercises.name: Overhead Shoulder Stretch
exercises.description: Reach one arm overhead and bend elbow behind head. Use other hand to gently pull elbow. Stretches triceps and shoulders.

exercises.name: Behind-the-Back Arm Stretch
exercises.description: Reach one arm behind back from below, other from above. Try to clasp hands or use a strap. Opens shoulders in multiple planes.

exercises.name: Downward Dog
exercises.description: Form inverted V-shape with body - hands and feet on ground, hips high. Classic yoga pose that opens shoulders, hamstrings, and calves.

exercises.name: Shoulder Opener (Elastic Band)
exercises.description: Hold elastic band with wide grip. Pull it over and behind head in a slow, controlled motion. Great for improving shoulder flexibility.

exercises.name: Shoulder Stretch (Seated, Backwards)
exercises.description: Sit with legs extended. Place hands behind you and walk them back to stretch anterior shoulders and chest while seated.

exercises.name: Wall Slides
exercises.description: Stand with back against wall. Slide arms up and down wall in 'W' to 'Y' pattern. Excellent rehab exercise for shoulder mobility and scapular control.

exercises.name: Arm Circles (Small, Forward)
exercises.description: Extend arms to sides. Make small controlled circles forward. Gentle dynamic warm-up for stiff shoulders.

exercises.name: Arm Circles (Small, Backward)
exercises.description: Extend arms to sides. Make small controlled circles backward. Activates posterior shoulder muscles.

exercises.name: Arm Circles (Large)
exercises.description: Make large, full range circular motions with arms. Progress to bigger circles as shoulders warm up. Dynamic flexibility builder.

exercises.name: Pendulum Swings
exercises.description: Bend forward, let one arm hang. Gently swing arm in circles and lines. Classic rehab exercise for shoulder mobility.

exercises.name: Thread the Needle
exercises.description: On hands and knees, reach one arm under body and through to opposite side. Excellent for thoracic and shoulder rotation.

exercises.name: Shoulder CARs (Controlled Articular Rotations)
exercises.description: Stand, move arm through full circular range of motion slowly and deliberately. Explores and expands shoulder mobility.

exercises.name: Wall Angels
exercises.description: Back against wall, arms in 'goal post' position. Slide arms up overhead and back down. Snow angel motion against wall.

exercises.name: Prone I Raises
exercises.description: Lie face down, arms extended overhead in 'I' shape. Lift arms slightly off ground. Gentle strengthening for overhead position.

exercises.name: Prone Y Raises
exercises.description: Lie face down, arms in 'Y' position (45 degrees from head). Lift arms off ground. Targets lower traps and shoulder stabilizers.

exercises.name: Prone T Raises
exercises.description: Lie face down, arms out to sides in 'T'. Lift arms with thumbs up. Strengthens mid-back and posterior shoulder.

exercises.name: Wall Shoulder Flexion
exercises.description: Face wall, walk fingers up as high as possible. Hold briefly at top. Gentle active stretch for overhead mobility.

exercises.name: Scapular Wall Slides
exercises.description: Face wall, hands on wall at chest height. Slide body toward wall by protracting/retracting shoulder blades. Scapular control drill.

exercises.name: Towel Slides
exercises.description: On smooth floor, hands on towels. Slide arms forward and back, or out to sides. Low-impact dynamic shoulder mobility.

exercises.name: Cross-Body Arm Swings
exercises.description: Swing arms across body in controlled motion, alternating. Dynamic warm-up for shoulder and chest.

exercises.name: Quadruped Shoulder Rotations
exercises.description: On hands and knees, rotate one shoulder externally/internally while keeping hand planted. Improves rotator cuff mobility.

exercises.name: Dynamic Sleeper Stretch
exercises.description: Lie on side, bend elbow 90 degrees. Gently rotate forearm toward floor in pulsing motion. Improves internal rotation.

exercises.name: Book Openers
exercises.description: Lie on side with knees bent. Open top arm like opening a book, following hand with eyes. Excellent thoracic rotation and shoulder opener.

exercises.name: Reverse Prayer Progression
exercises.description: Bring hands behind back, press palms together with fingers pointing up. If too difficult, clasp hands or forearms. Advanced shoulder mobility.

exercises.name: Shoulder Elevation/Depression
exercises.description: Stand with arms overhead. Actively push up (elevate) then pull down (depress). Builds awareness of shoulder blade control.

exercises.name: Wall Handstand Hold
exercises.description: Hold a handstand against a wall to build strength and endurance. Focus on maintaining hollow body position.

exercises.name: Handstand Shoulder Taps
exercises.description: In a wall handstand, carefully tap alternating shoulders while maintaining balance.

exercises.name: Chest-to-Wall Handstand
exercises.description: Face the wall in handstand position. This variation emphasizes proper alignment and balance.

exercises.name: Handstand Walk (Wall)
exercises.description: In wall handstand, walk hands side to side to build coordination and strength.

exercises.name: Plank Hold
exercises.description: Hold a plank position with straight body line. Builds foundational core strength and shoulder stability for handstands.

exercises.name: Walk To Feet
exercises.description: From plank, walk feet toward hands to create inverted V position. Builds shoulder strength and prepares for handstand entry.

exercises.name: Walk To Hands
exercises.description: From inverted V position, walk hands toward feet. Develops shoulder mobility and strength in pike position.

exercises.name: Walk To Feet (Elevated)
exercises.description: Walk feet up onto elevated surface like box or chair. More challenging variation that increases shoulder load.

exercises.name: Planche Leans
exercises.description: In plank, shift weight forward over hands as far as possible. Advanced exercise building straight-arm pressing strength.

exercises.name: Wall Crow
exercises.description: Squat with hands on ground, knees on elbows, feet against wall. Fundamental position for learning handstand balance and control.

exercises.name: Wall Crow Entries
exercises.description: Practice entering Wall Crow position repeatedly. Builds confidence and muscle memory for handstand entries.

exercises.name: Wall Crow Push Outs
exercises.description: From Wall Crow, push hips up toward wall handstand position then return. Builds strength for handstand press-ups.

exercises.name: Wall Crow (Max Hold)
exercises.description: Hold Wall Crow position for maximum time. Tests endurance and mental focus in inverted position.

exercises.name: Wall Crow (Chair Variation)
exercises.description: Perform Wall Crow with feet elevated on chair. Increases shoulder angle and difficulty.

exercises.name: Wall Crow (1-Leg Isolation)
exercises.description: In Wall Crow, extend one leg at a time. Develops unilateral control and balance for freestanding handstands.

exercises.name: Wall Crow (Shoulder Shrugs)
exercises.description: In Wall Crow hold, perform shoulder elevation and depression. Advanced scapular control exercise.

exercises.name: Wall Crow (Legs Isolation)
exercises.description: In Wall Crow, lift both legs off elbows simultaneously. Very advanced control exercise preparing for press to handstand.

exercises.name: Wall Crow to Handstand
exercises.description: From Wall Crow, press up to full wall handstand. Advanced pressing movement requiring significant shoulder and core strength.

exercises.name: Kick-Up Practice (Wall)
exercises.description: Practice kicking up to wall handstand. Start gently, focus on controlled entry. Fundamental handstand entry skill.

exercises.name: Kick-Up Drills (Partner Spot)
exercises.description: Practice kick-ups with partner spotting. Build confidence for freestanding attempts.

exercises.name: Handstand Negative (Wall)
exercises.description: Start in wall handstand, slowly lower down with control. Eccentric strength builder for press to handstand.

exercises.name: Tuck Handstand Negative
exercises.description: From wall handstand, tuck knees to chest, slowly lower down. Easier variation of handstand negative.

exercises.name: Straddle Handstand Negative
exercises.description: From wall handstand, spread legs wide (straddle), lower down with control. Intermediate press progression.

exercises.name: L-Sit (Floor)
exercises.description: Sit with legs extended, hands beside hips. Press down to lift entire body off ground. Fundamental gymnastics strength hold.

exercises.name: L-Sit (Parallettes)
exercises.description: L-sit on parallettes or blocks. Extra height makes it easier than floor version. Great progression step.

exercises.name: Tuck L-Sit
exercises.description: Hands on floor, pull knees to chest and lift hips off ground. Beginner L-sit progression.

exercises.name: One-Leg L-Sit
exercises.description: Lift body with one leg extended, one bent. Easier than full L-sit, good for building strength.

exercises.name: V-Sit
exercises.description: Like L-sit but lift legs higher to create V shape with body. Advanced core and hip flexor strength.

exercises.name: Pike Compression
exercises.description: Stand, fold forward and hug legs to chest. Pull upper body down to legs. Essential flexibility for press to handstand.

exercises.name: Seated Pike Compression
exercises.description: Sit with legs extended, lean forward and pull chest to thighs. Hold. Builds pike compression strength.

exercises.name: Elevated Pike Push-Up
exercises.description: Feet on box/chair, pike position, perform push-up. More vertical than regular pike push-up, mimics handstand pressing angle.

exercises.name: Headstand Hold
exercises.description: Balance on head and forearms. Gentler inversion than handstand, builds spatial awareness and balance.

exercises.name: Tripod Headstand
exercises.description: Head and hands form triangle, knees rest on elbows. Beginner-friendly inversion building confidence.

exercises.name: Forearm Stand (Wall)
exercises.description: Handstand on forearms instead of hands. Lower center of gravity, easier balance. Great for building confidence.

exercises.name: Straddle Press Attempt
exercises.description: From pike with legs wide, attempt to lift hips and legs while leaning shoulders forward. Press to handstand progression.

exercises.name: Tuck Press Practice
exercises.description: From squat, hands down, lean forward and lift feet. Tucked press to handstand is easiest press variation.

exercises.name: Press Lean Holds
exercises.description: From pike, lean shoulders far forward, hold. Builds shoulder strength for press entry without going all the way up.

exercises.name: Handstand Hops
exercises.description: In handstand position, perform small hops with hands. Advanced balance and shoulder control exercise.

exercises.name: Handstand Splits
exercises.description: In wall handstand, open legs into splits position. Requires hip flexibility and core control.

exercises.name: Frog Stand
exercises.description: Squat, place hands flat, knees on elbows, lean forward until feet lift. Essential balancing skill, beginner arm balance.

exercises.name: Crow Pose
exercises.description: Like frog stand but lift hips higher, straighten arms more. Classic yoga arm balance preparing for handstands.

exercises.name: Tuck Planche Lean
exercises.description: In tuck position on hands, lean forward as far as possible. Builds straight-arm strength for advanced skills.

exercises.name: Handstand Pirouette Practice
exercises.description: In handstand, practice small rotations (quarter turns). Advanced skill building rotation control.

exercises.name: Wall Walks
exercises.description: Start in plank facing away from wall. Walk feet up wall while walking hands toward wall. Full body strength builder.

exercises.name: Handstand Hold (Stomach to Wall)
exercises.description: Walk up to handstand with stomach facing wall. More challenging balance than back-to-wall, closer to freestanding.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: A core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time.

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.description: Classic upper body exercise. Lower body to ground and push back up, keeping core tight.

exercises.name: Pike Push-ups
exercises.description: Start in downward dog position. Lower head to ground, focusing on shoulder strength.

exercises.name: Hollow Body Hold
exercises.description: Lie on back, press lower back to ground, lift shoulders and legs. This builds core strength for handstands.

exercises.name: Shoulder Shrugs (Standing)
exercises.description: Stand with arms at sides. Elevate shoulders toward ears, hold briefly, then depress. Strengthens upper traps and improves shoulder mobility.

exercises.name: Shoulder Shrugs (On Knees)
exercises.description: On hands and knees, perform shoulder elevation and depression while maintaining plank-like position. Builds scapular strength for handstands.

exercises.name: Planche Leans
exercises.description: In plank, lean shoulders forward past wrists as far as possible. Hold and return. Builds straight-arm strength for advanced skills.

exercises.name: Forearm Planche Leans
exercises.description: On forearms in plank, lean forward past elbows. Forearm variation for building strength progressively.

exercises.name: Press Leans
exercises.description: From pike position, lean shoulders forward over hands. Key exercise for learning press to handstand.

exercises.name: Scissors (On Back)
exercises.description: Lie on back with legs raised. Alternate crossing legs in scissor motion. Great for lower abs and hip flexors.

exercises.name: Flutter Kicks
exercises.description: Lie on back with legs elevated. Make small alternating kicking motions. Builds lower ab endurance.

exercises.name: Abs Twists
exercises.description: Sit with legs elevated, lean back slightly. Twist torso side to side, touching hands to ground. Works obliques and rotational strength.

exercises.name: Fire Hydrant
exercises.description: On hands and knees, lift one leg out to side while keeping knee bent. Strengthens glutes and hip abductors.

exercises.name: Knee Extensions
exercises.description: Sit with one leg extended, other bent. Lift bent leg and extend knee, then lower. Strengthens quads and improves knee stability.

exercises.name: Toe Taps
exercises.description: Lie on back with legs in tabletop. Slowly lower and tap one toe to ground, then return. Alternating. Core stability exercise.

exercises.name: Leg Lifts (One Leg Isolation)
exercises.description: Lie face down. Lift one leg at a time while keeping it straight. Isolates glutes and hamstrings unilaterally.

exercises.name: Leg Kicks (Side)
exercises.description: Stand or lie on side. Kick leg out to side in controlled motion. Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability.

exercises.name: Leg Kicks (Back)
exercises.description: Standing, kick one leg back while maintaining upright posture. Activates glutes and improves balance.

exercises.name: Hollow Body (Wall)
exercises.description: Lie on back with arms overhead against wall. Lift shoulders and legs while pressing lower back to floor. Advanced hollow body variation.

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunches
exercises.description: Lie on back, bring opposite elbow to knee in cycling motion. Excellent for obliques and rotational core strength.

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.description: Lie on back with arms up and legs in tabletop. Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping core engaged. Great for core stability.

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.description: On hands and knees, extend opposite arm and leg. Hold briefly then switch. Builds posterior chain strength and balance.

exercises.name: Scapular Push-ups
exercises.description: In plank position, protract and retract shoulder blades without bending elbows. Essential for handstand shoulder strength.

exercises.name: Arch Body Hold
exercises.description: Lie face down, lift chest and legs simultaneously creating arch. Opposite of hollow body, strengthens posterior chain.

exercises.name: Wall Sits
exercises.description: Back against wall, slide down to seated position with thighs parallel to ground. Hold. Great for leg endurance.

exercises.name: Reverse Plank
exercises.description: Sit with legs extended, hands behind. Lift hips to create straight line. Opens chest and strengthens posterior chain.

exercises.name: L-Sit Progression
exercises.description: Sit with hands beside hips. Press down to lift hips, extend legs forward. Build towards full L-sit. Excellent gymnastics strength builder.

exercises.name: Wrist Stretch
exercises.description: A stretch to improve flexibility and prevent injury in the wrists. Extend arm and gently pull fingers back.

exercises.name: Shoulder Stretch
exercises.description: Pull one arm across body using the other arm. Hold to stretch the shoulder.

exercises.name: Child's Pose
exercises.description: Sit back on heels with arms extended forward on the ground. Great for shoulder and back relaxation.

exercises.name: Bridge Stretch
exercises.description: Lie on back, lift hips up while keeping shoulders on ground. Great for spine and shoulder flexibility.

exercises.name: Sphinx (Active)
exercises.description: Lie face down, prop on forearms with chest lifted. Actively engage back muscles. Excellent for spine extension and counteracting desk posture.

exercises.name: Sphinx (Passive)
exercises.description: Similar to active sphinx but relax into the stretch. Hold for sustained spinal extension.

exercises.name: Cobra (Active)
exercises.description: From sphinx, straighten arms to lift chest higher. Actively press into ground. Deeper spinal extension than sphinx.

exercises.name: Cobra (Passive)
exercises.description: Hold cobra pose, relaxing into the stretch. Focus on breathing deeply.

exercises.name: Butterfly (Forward)
exercises.description: Sit with soles of feet together, fold forward. Stretches hips, inner thighs, and lower back.

exercises.name: Butterfly (Passive)
exercises.description: Sit with soles together, let knees drop naturally. Gentle hip opening stretch.

exercises.name: Butterfly (Side)
exercises.description: From butterfly position, lean to one side. Stretches obliques and lateral hip.

exercises.name: Wrist Stretch (Reverse)
exercises.description: Place hands flat with fingers pointing toward body. Lean back gently. Essential for office workers and handstand prep.

exercises.name: One Arm Chest Stretch
exercises.description: Place hand on wall or doorframe, rotate body away. Opens chest and anterior shoulder. Perfect for desk workers.

exercises.name: Half-Split
exercises.description: In lunge position, straighten front leg and fold forward. Hamstring and calf stretch.

exercises.name: Half-Split (Side Bend)
exercises.description: From half-split, reach arm over to side. Adds lateral flexion and deeper hamstring stretch.

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Kneel on one knee, push hips forward. Crucial stretch for office workers with tight hip flexors.

exercises.name: Standing Forward Bend
exercises.description: Stand, fold forward toward toes. Let head hang. Stretches entire posterior chain.

exercises.name: Neck Rolls
exercises.description: Slowly roll head in circular motion. Relieves neck tension from computer work.

exercises.name: Neck Side Stretch
exercises.description: Tilt head to side, gently pull with hand. Stretches lateral neck muscles.

exercises.name: Upper Trap Stretch
exercises.description: Tilt head diagonally down, add gentle pressure with hand. Targets upper traps and neck.

exercises.name: Thoracic Extension
exercises.description: Sit or kneel, hands behind head. Arch upper back over foam roller or chair. Counteracts rounded desk posture.

exercises.name: Cat-Cow
exercises.description: On hands and knees, alternate between arching and rounding spine. Excellent for spinal mobility.

exercises.name: Forearm Stretch (Flexors)
exercises.description: Extend arm, palm up, pull fingers back. Stretches wrist and forearm flexors. Great for typing strain.

exercises.name: Forearm Stretch (Extensors)
exercises.description: Extend arm, palm down, pull fingers down. Stretches wrist and forearm extensors.

exercises.name: Finger Stretches
exercises.description: Spread fingers wide, make fists, pull each finger back individually. Relieves hand tension from typing.

exercises.name: Ankle Circles
exercises.description: Rotate ankle in circles, both directions. Improves ankle mobility and circulation.

exercises.name: Toe Stretches
exercises.description: Sit, interlace fingers between toes and gently spread. Relieves foot tension.

exercises.name: Seated Spinal Twist
exercises.description: Sit cross-legged, rotate torso to one side. Hold knee for leverage. Great for spine mobility.

exercises.name: Quad Stretch (Standing)
exercises.description: Stand, pull foot toward glutes. Keep knees together. Classic quad stretch.

exercises.name: Pigeon Pose
exercises.description: Front leg bent, back leg extended. Fold forward. Deep hip opener, especially for office workers.

exercises.name: Figure Four Stretch
exercises.description: Lie on back, cross ankle over opposite knee, pull leg toward chest. Targets piriformis and outer hip.

exercises.name: Shoulder Blade Squeeze
exercises.description: Stand or sit, squeeze shoulder blades together. Hold and release. Counters rounded shoulders from desk work.

exercises.name: Triceps Stretch
exercises.description: Reach arm overhead, bend elbow, use other hand to gently push elbow. Stretches triceps and lat.

exercises.name: Lat Stretch (Doorway)
exercises.description: Hold doorframe overhead, lean body away. Deep lat and side body stretch.

exercises.name: Calf Stretch (Wall)
exercises.description: Place hands on wall, step one foot back, keep heel down. Classic calf stretch.
